vista.graph
Class Plot

java.lang.Object
  vista.graph.GraphicElement
      vista.graph.GEContainer
          vista.graph.Plot
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Animate, Bounded, BoundedComposite, Child, Composite, Drawable, DrawableComposite, FontResizable, Layoutable, Leaf, Parent
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiPlot
public class Plot
extends GEContainer
implements FontResizable

A plot is defined as an area with atmost four axes aligned so as to make up a rectangle. A plot simply contains Axis and Curve objects. The GEBorderLayout is used to manage the layout of these elements

It also manages the creation of axes and curves for a plot. interior area is scaled from the axes ranges. The DataSet (s) to be plotted are added to the plot and particular axis positions. A Curve element is then created for each such DataSet.

Version:
$Id: Plot.java,v 1.1 2003/10/02 20:49:06 redwood Exp $
Author:
Nicky Sandhu
See Also:
Curve, DataSet, Axis

createAxis

public Axis createAxis(int axisPosition)
The preconditions are that axis positon can only be top, left, bottom or right and the layout has to be border layout.

Returns:
the Axis object or if null then create an axis add it to layout and return it.

addGrid

public void addGrid(int position)
adds grid lines for the axis (lines perpendicular to axis running the distance of the plot area). The grid lines are placed at major tick marks for the given axis.

Parameters:
position - The position of the axis
